sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to union.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {4, 5}. Find (A × B) ∪ (B × A) and (B × A) ∪ (A × B). Verify that the sets obtained are not equal and hence prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to union.
